refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: A matching on a graph is a set of edges such that no two of them share a node in common. The largest possible matching on a graph with n nodes consists of n/2 edges, and such a matching is called a perfect matching. Although not all graphs have perfect matchings, a maximum matching exists for each graph.

best_match finds an maximum matching for the graph g. The output are card and the vector match. card is the cardinality of an optimal matching. match(i) is the node adjacent to node i in the maximum matching or 0 if i is unmatched.
